# pyinvoke`pyinvoke` is a simple module that is used to invoked Python applicationsusing a full function specifier, similar to distlib entrypoints.The key advantage is that the Python application you want to run will beloaded as its proper module instead of as the `__main__` module. `pyinvoke`will be the `__main__` module for this operation.One of the motivating cases where `pyinvoke` comes in handy is the following: $ python -m module.main Traceback (most recent call last): File "module/main.py", line 7, in from .stuff import ham SystemError: Parent module '' not loaded, cannot perform relative importTo run the application with `pyinvoke`: $ python3 -m pyinvoke module.main:mainApplications that depend on restarting can read the original commandlinefrom `sys.__argv__`:```pythonargv = getattr(sys, '__argv__', sys.argv)```---
